I am an assistant professor in the Department of Health Sciences and at the Roux Institute, Northeastern University. I am an epidemiologist and biostatistician with expertise in reproductive and perinatal epidemiology and causal inference. I am passionate about teaching and mentoring students in epidemiology and biostatistics.


### Education

- **PhD**, Population Health Sciences (Epidemiologic Methods)
  - Harvard University
- **SM**, Biostatistics
  - Harvard University
- **MS**, Epidemiology
  - University of California, Berkeley
- **AB**, Comparative Literature / Community Health
  - Brown University
